data.title: Songwriter Dori Caymmi Featured on Upcoming "I Know This Guy" Podcast — prREACH Viral Social VIDEO Press Release Service
data.meta_description: Norman Farrar is set to host Dori Caymmi, a Brazilian singer-songwriter, on the latest episode of the popular podcast, “I Know This Guy.”
data.text:
summary

Norman Farrar is set to host Dori Caymmi, a Brazilian singer-songwriter, on the latest episode of the popular “I Know This Guy” podcast airing December 14, 2020. Continue reading →

Fort Lauderdale, FL, Dec 21, 2020 /prREACH/ -- Norman Farrar, known around the globe as The Beard Guy, is happy to host Brazilian singer-songwriter Dori Caymmi on his upcoming "I Know This Guy" podcast episode set to air live this week.

Visit Apple Podcasts for the full "I Know This Guy" show at https://podcasts.apple.com/ca/podcast/i-know-this-guy-with-norm-farrar/id1518495668.

Farrar is looking forward to exploring the Brazilian music genre, Bossa Nova, with the very talented music arranger, Dori Caymmi. Born in Rio de Janeiro to musician parents, Caymmi studied music theory and harmony at the Conservatório Lorenzo Fernandez.

With time, he continued to explore different avenues for expressing his musical talent. He became a member of Grupo dos Sete and composed music for TV while also directing the play Opinião and contributing to the growth of música popular brasileira (MPB). He worked as a producer for Eumir Deodato, Edu Lobo, and Nara Leão and as a composer and songwriter with Nelson Motta.

His album Cinema: A Romantic Vision (Zebra, 1999) received a Latin Grammy Award nomination for his arrangement of The Pink Panther theme by Henry Mancini. Influências was nominated for a Latin Grammy for Best Contemporary Brazilian album in 2001. Some of its songs pay homage to Caymmi's father: "La Vem A Baiana" and "Acontece Que Eu Sou Baiano." Contemporâneos, recorded in 2003, was nominated for a Latin Grammy for Best Contemporary Brazilian album. His 2013 album, "Caymmi," with siblings Nana Caymmi and Danilo Caymmi, was nominated for the 2014 Latin Grammy Award for Best MPB Album. In 2015, he was nominated for the Latin Grammy Awards again, this time with Mario Adnet and for the Best MPB Album and Producer of the Year categories for producing the album, "Centenário Caymmi."

Listen to Caymmi discuss his journey and experience on "I Know This Guy," a podcast hosted by Norman Farrar and produced by Hayden Farrar. With an entrepreneurship journey spanning more than three decades, Farrar has undoubtedly earned the title of "master networker." Through his professional journey, he has met people from all walks of life and from all over the world. "This podcast is my way of sharing the knowledge of my network with the rest of the world," Farrar says.

Farrar's musically talented son, Hayden, is the producer of the show. As a freelance and touring musician, Hayden Farrar's experience opened up his eyes to the importance of strong community values. He shares his father's curiosity for the stories behind everyday people. He hopes that this podcast creates a community of its own, in shared stories and life experiences that anyone can find value in.

To learn more about the Brazilian arranger, Caymmi, or to hear previous interviews where Norman Farrar talks with the most influential entrepreneurs, artists, athletes, and more from around the world, visit the official "I Know This Guy" website at https://iknowthisguy.com/.

About Norman Farrar

Entrepreneur and businessman Norman "The Beard Guy" Farrar stands at the forefront of the economic mega-machine known as Amazon Marketplace. As a leading expert with over 25 years of product sourcing, development, and branding expertise, Norm is an advisor to many and an inspiration to all.

Throughout his career, he has worked with big brands including Mercedes-Benz, Coca-Cola, Dell, Microsoft, Target, Hershey, 20th Century Fox, Molson's, Cadbury and a wide variety of emerging businesses that are celebrating sudden escalation in profitability and sales as a result of taking action on his advice and proven methods.

About Dori Caymmi

Dori directed the play Opinião and performed on violão for it in 1964, contributing to the growth of música popular brasileira (MPB). He worked as a producer for Eumir Deodato, Edu Lobo, and Nara Leão and as a composer with Nelson Motta.

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dori_Caymmi
